sect2.title: Introduction to DHCP
sect2.para: The DHCP package contains both the client and server programs for DHCP. dhclient (the client) is useful for connecting your computer to a network which uses DHCP to assign network addresses. dhcpd (the server) is useful for assigning network addresses on your private network.

sect2.title: Installation of DHCP

note.para: You must have Packet Socket support compiled in the kernel and Socket Filtering either compiled in or as a kernel module.

sect2.para: Install DHCP by running the following commands:

userinput.command: patch -Np1 -i ../dhcp-&dhcp-version;-iproute2-1.patch && ./configure && make && make LIBDIR=/usr/lib INCDIR=/usr/include install

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: LIBDIR=/usr/lib INCDIR=/usr/include: This command installs the library and include files in /usr instead of /usr/local.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The DHCP package contains dhclient, dhcpd and dhcrelay.

sect3.title: dhclient
sect3.para: dhclient is the implementation of the DHCP client.

sect3.title: dhcpd
sect3.para: dhcpd implements Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) and Internet Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP) requests for network addresses.

sect3.title: dhcrelay
sect3.para: dhcrelay provides a means to accept DHCP and BOOTP requests on a subnet without a DHCP server and relay them to a DHCP server on another subnet.
